term.title: solvophobicity parameter

item.text: A solvent parameter defined by: Sp = 1- M M hexadecane) of a series of solutes from water to numerous aqueous-organic mixtures and to pure solvents: Δ t G° to solvent = M R T + D is a solute parameter, and M and D characterize the solvent. The M values are used to define a solvent solvophobic effect so that Sp values are scaled from unity (water) to zero (hexadecane).

item.alttext: Δ t G° to solvent = M R T + D
